sen.j: 永観（ようかん・えいかん、長元6年（1033年） - 天永2年11月2日 (旧暦)（1111年12月4日））は、平安時代後期の三論宗の僧。
sen.e: Yokan or Eikan (1033-December 4, 1111) was a priest of Sanronshu (The Three-Discourse Sect of Buddhism) in the later Heian period.
Yokan or Eikan (1033-December 4, 1111) was a priest of Sanronshu (The Three-Discourse Sect of Buddhism) in the later Heian period.
Yokan (or Eikan) (1033 - December 11, 1111) was a priest of Sanron sect (The Three-Discourse Sect of Buddhism) in the later Heian period.
sen.cmt: 三論宗→Sanron sect としました。

sen.j: 実父は文章生源国経で、石清水八幡宮別当元命の養子となる。
sen.e: His father was MINAMOTO Kunitsune, a doctor of literature, and Yokan was adopted by Motonaga, the head priest of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 国経は文章博士になったと思います。
sen.e: His father was MINAMOTO Kunitsune, a doctor of literature, and Yokan was adopted by Motonaga, the head priest of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine.
His father was MINAMOTO no Kunitsune, monjosho (student of literary studies in the Imperial University), and Yokan was adopted by Genmei, betto (the head priest) of Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 文章、別当 を追加しました。元命→Genmei としました。

sen.j: 禅林寺 (京都市)の7世住持であり、中興の祖とされる。
sen.e: He was the seventh head priest of Zenrin-ji Temple (in Kyoto) and the great contributor to the restoration of the temple.
He was the seventh head priest of Zenrin-ji Temple (in Kyoto) and the great contributor to the restoration of the temple.
He was the seventh head priest of Zenrin-ji Temple (Kyoto City) and the great contributor to the restoration of the temple.

sen.j: 禅林寺の通称である「永観堂」は永観にちなむものである。
sen.e: "Eikando," the another name of Zenrin-ji Temple, derives from his name.
"Eikando," the other name of Zenrin-ji Temple, derives from his name.
"Eikando," the other name of Zenrin-ji Temple, derives from his name.

sen.j: 11歳で禅林寺の深観（じんかん）に師事し、受戒した後東大寺東南院に住して有慶（ゆうきょう）・顕真に師事して三論教学を学び、その他法相教学にも通じた。
sen.e: He studied esoteric teachings under Jinkan at Zenrin-ji Temple at the age of eleven, Sanronshu's teachings under Yukyo and Kenshin at Todai-ji Temple living in Tonan-in of the temple after accepting the precepts, and also teachings of Hossoshu (The Dharama-Charactersitics Sect of Buddhism).

He studied the esoteric teachings under Jinkan at Zenrin-ji Temple at the age of eleven, Sanronshu's teachings under Yukyo and Kenshin at Todai-ji Temple living in Tonan-in of the temple after accepting the precepts, and also teachings of Hossoshu (The Dharama-Charactersitics Sect of Buddhism).

He studied the esoteric teachings under Jinkan at Zenrin-ji Temple at the age of 11, Sanron teachings under Yukyo and Kenshin at Todai-ji Temple living in Tonan-in of the temple after accepting the precepts, and also Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study (The Dharama-Charactersitics Sect of Buddhism).
sen.cmt: 三論教学→Sanron teachings としました。法相教学→Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study としました。

sen.j: この頃から浄土教に帰依して一万遍の念仏を日課とし、1062年（康平5年）山城国光明寺 (綾部市)に隠棲した。
sen.e: At that time, he devoted himself to Jodoshu (The Pure Land Sect of Buddhism), made ten thousand practices of the nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) the daily routine, and retired to Komyo-ji Temple (in Ayabe City) in Yamashiro Province in 1062.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At that time, he devoted himself to Jodoshu (The Pure Land Sect of Buddhism), made ten thousand practices of the nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) the daily routine, and retired to Komyo-ji Temple (in Ayabe City) in Yamashiro Province in 1062.

At that time, he devoted himself to Jodo (Pure Land) sect, made Ichimanben Nenbutsu (ten thousand practices of the Buddhist invocation) the daily routine, and retired to Komyo-ji Temple (Ayabe City) in Yamashiro Province in 1062.
sen.cmt: 一万遍念仏 を追加しました。

sen.j: その後、浄土教を民間に布教するため、1072年（延久4年）に禅林寺に戻りそこに住し、人々に念仏を勧め、寺内に「薬王院」を設け、病人救済などの事業を行なった。
sen.e: Then, he returned to Zenrin-ji Temple in 1072 to promulgate Jodoshu to people, encouraged them to practice the nenbutsu, and established "Yakuo-in" on the ground of the temple which performed public services caring for the ill and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, he returned to Zenrin-ji Temple in 1072 to promulgate Jodoshu and encouraged followers to practice the nenbutsu, and established "Yakuo-in" on the grounds of the temple which performed public services caring for the ill and so on.

Then, he returned to Zenrin-ji Temple in 1072 to promulgate Jodo sect and encouraged followers to practice the nenbutsu, and established 'Yakuo-in' on the grounds of the temple which performed public services caring for the ill and so on.

sen.j: 下記のような伝承がある。
sen.e: This episode below hands down to subsequent generations.

sen.j: 1082年（永保2年）、50歳の永観が日課の念仏を唱えながら、本尊の阿弥陀如来の周りを行道していると、阿弥陀如来が須弥壇を下り、共に行道を始めた。
sen.e: In 1082, when Yokan at age fifty was walking around the statue of Amida Nyorai, the main revered figure, reciting the nenbutsu as his daily routine, Amida Nyorai stepped down from the sacred platform and began to walk with Yokan.

In 1082, when Yokan at age fifty was walking around the statue of Amida Nyorai, the main revered figure, reciting the nenbutsu as his daily routine, Amida Nyorai stepped down from the sacred platform and began to walk with Yokan.

sen.j: 永観が驚いて立ち止まると、阿弥陀如来は振り返り、「永観遅し」と言ったという。
sen.e: As Yokan halted in astonishment, Amida Nyorai turned around and said "Yokan, you are slow."

sen.j: よって、本尊の阿弥陀如来立像は、顔を向かって左に曲げる独特の姿をしている。
sen.e: That is why the standing statue of Amida Nyorai, the main revered figure, uniquely turns his face to the observer's left.
That is why the standing statue of Amida Nyorai, the main revered figure, uniquely turns his face to the observer's left.

sen.j: 1099年（康和元年）権律師に任じられたが辞退している。
sen.e: In 1099, he was appointed as Gonrisshi (the lowest grade that can be held by one who has reached the third rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests), but declined it.
In 1099, he was appointed as Gonrisshi (the lowest grade that can be held by one who has reached the third rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests), but declined it.
In 1099, he was appointed as Gon no Risshi (generally in Shingon sect, 15th-ranking Buddhist priest, literally, "supernumerary master of discipline"), but declined it.
sen.cmt: 権律師 の補足を変更しました。

sen.j: その後東大寺別当にも任じられて一旦は辞退したが再び任じられ、正倉院などを修理している。
sen.e: After that, he was appointed as head priest of Todai-ji Temple and declined it, but assumed it when he was appointed again, and renovated Shosoin (the treasure house) and so on.
